citation.article-title: Description of Sulfurospirillum halorespirans sp. nov., an anaerobic, tetrachloroethene-respiring bacterium, and transfer of Dehalospirillum multivorans to the genus Sulfurospirillum as Sulfurospirillum multivorans comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Sulfurospirillum Schumacher et al. 1993
The original description of this genus was provided by Schumacher et al. (1992).
Additionally, some species are able to use arsenate, selenate, PCE or trichloroethene as terminal electron acceptors.
The type species is Sulfurospirillum deleyianum.
